noun.description: A subdivision of a company of soldiers, usually forming a tactical unit that is commanded by a lieutenant and divided into several sections.

verb.description: (in baseball and other sports) have (an athlete) play in rotation with one or more teammates at the same position.
examples: he was underrated because of Stengel's platooning him with Woodling

origin: Mid 17th century: from French peloton platoon, literally small ball, diminutive of pelote.
